alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Johnston; Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 11:39PM EDT until July 08 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR CUMBERLAND, SOUTHEASTERN HARNETT, NORTHEASTERN HOKE, SOUTHERN JOHNSTON, NORTHERN SAMPSON AND SOUTHERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 1139 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This includes Interstate 95 between Benson and Fayetteville and Interstate 40 between Benson and Warsaw. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fayetteville, Clinton, Mount Olive, Fort Bragg, Dunn, Benson, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Erwin, Eastover, Coats, Newton Grove, Wade, Turkey, Falcon, Linden, Seven Springs and Spivey`s Corner. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Johnston; Sampson; Wayne
